channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: AFL chief executive Gillon McLachlan has confirmed that the 2020 season will resume on June 11 - 81 days after it was shut down due to the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: AFL 2020 season will resume on June 11: McLachlan

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: NSW eases COVID-19 restrictions as pubs, clubs set to reopen; Australian unemployment rate soars as nation's death toll stands at 98

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: major easing of COVID-19 restrictions from midnight and national cabinet meets

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: A giant ''sponge'' has been wetted in northern NSW, opening the way for what's hoped to be Narran Lakes' first major waterbird breeding event for almost a decade.
item.title: 'Just magic': First big flows in seven years start key wetland revival

item.description: All players and staff are being tested for COVID-19 before returning to the club.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Enormous doses of stimulus spending are offering relief from coronavirus damage but their lifelong legacy of debt could sow seeds for future crises.
item.title: 'Who is going to pay for this?': Coronavirus to leave a legacy of unprecedented global debt

item.dc:creator: Fleta Page
item.description: Scott Morrison has pledged $48.1 million in additional support for mental health in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Scott Morrison commits $48m for mental health, elective surgery to resume

item.dc:creator: Max Presnell
item.description: John Hawkes-trained sprinter looked a class apart when winning at Randwick last weekend and can back up in a quality field at Rosehill on Saturday.
item.title: Masked Crusader the cream of the crop in Scone Guineas

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.description: Sydney living with Coronavirus, April 17, 2020
item.title: Sydney living with Coronavirus, April 17, 2020

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Education Minister Grace Grace says she played no part in the appointment of a principal at a new high school at Dutton Park and has not been called to give evidence as part of a corruption probe into the matter.
item.title: Education Minister says she knew nothing about Trad's principal meeting

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The fixtures for round three and four of the relaunched NRL season have been decided and old rivalries will be kicking things off.
item.title: NRL draw revealed: Broncos and Eels showdown to kick off opening weekend

item.description: When the sentence was handed down Gerard McNamara, who'd kept his eyes shut as details of his offending were read out, picked up a small suitcase and followed guards from the room.
item.title: Marist Brother known as 'The Rat' gets more jail time for abusing boys

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: The 2020 AFL season will resume on June 11 with West Coast and Fremantle to play their initial matches on the Gold Coast.
item.title: Eagles, Dockers swing back to AFL action on Gold Coast in mid June

item.description: President Andres Obrador's approach to government spending might best be compared to that of conservative icons Ronald Reagan and Margaret Thatcher.
item.title: The world is spending to fight coronavirus but Mexico is making cuts

item.description: The Health Department projects that by 2026, hospitalisations will have risen by 54 per cent unless the problem is addressed.
item.title: Obesity predicted to cost WA $610 million per year by 2026

item.description: Malaysian Airlines Flight 17 was en route from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur when it was shot down on July 17 2014 over rebel-controlled eastern Ukraine.
item.title: Suspect in MH17 shoot-down case arrested in Ukraine

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Melbourne Cup-winning trainer Danny O'Brien is looking to increase his arsenal for this year's great race with King Of Leogrance in the exempt Andrew Ramsden Stakes.
item.title: King Of Leogrance out to add to O'Brien's Cup contenders

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: The parties have been locked in negotiations for the past week and on Friday morning issued a joint statement that they had reached 'mutually beneficial terms'.
item.title: Qantas, Perth Airport break bread and resolve fees dispute

item.description: Mannequins dressed in fine 1940's-style attire were already theatrically staged at The Inn at Little Washington, near Virginia's Blue Ridge Mountains.
item.title: In a time of social distancing, one restaurant adds mannequins

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Already hurt by the bushfires, Victoria's bottom line has taken a massive battering from the pandemic, with the situation likely to get substantially worse.
item.title: Pallas says fires cost state $500m, pandemic set to be '140 times worse'

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: A woman has been charged with more than 120 counts of fraud and theft after she allegedly stole the personal details of more than 60 people.
item.title: Perth woman to face court over $500,0000 fraud, identify theft

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Souths have confirmed their new-look back line with Latrell Mitchell to be retained in the No.1 and Campbell Graham the new right centre for James Roberts.
item.title: How new Souths back line will look as Roberts remains in rehab

item.description: With 17 grand slam titles - two behind Rafa Nadal and three fewer than Roger Federer - the world No.1 says he has no doubt in his ability to overtake them.
item.title: Djokovic confident he will claim grand slam record

item.dc:creator: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon
item.description: The big-four banks are now offering interest rates that are close to the best in the market. If you’re with one already, today you might consider fixing half your loan.
item.title: The best home loans for cutting mortgage repayments

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Queensland Nationals MP George Christensen has risked inflaming already heightened diplomatic tensions with China by doubling down on his attempts to call the nation's ambassador before a parliamentary committee.
item.title: Nationals MP invites Chinese ambassador to front trade inquiry

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Richard Glover
item.description: Clancy is forced to sing for his supper when Man and Lady idle through lockdown.
item.title: One dog's 'Cheese Song' is a prompt for another beer

item.dc:creator: Michael Dwyer
item.description: As AC/DC's landmark album turns 40, questions burn as indelibly as its legacy. There's even a conspiracy theory.
item.title: 40 years on from Back in Black, AC/DC still matters

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Human rights lawyer Amal Clooney has urged Australia to go after companies complicit in human rights abuses, including against Uighur Muslims in China.
item.title: Amal Clooney fronts parliamentary hearing on sanctions for human rights abusers

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police were called to the Bruce Highway south of Bowen, where the body was located, about 7am on Friday.
item.title: Body found on major north Queensland road

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Seven further charges have been laid against Brett Callaghan, accused of abducting the 12-year-old girl, bringing the total number of charges to 10.
item.title: Man in court after girl allegedly abducted from skatepark, sexually assaulted

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Clean-cut and articulate, footballer Nathan Cleary was a marketer’s dream. And then those TikTok videos emerged.
item.title: Dance video the first misstep in career of golden boy Nathan Cleary

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: Communities are likely to have to help themselves recover from the coronavirus pandemic. The story of rural village pubs, owned by their communities, offers hope.
item.title: Hope on the menu at community-owned pubs in a closed pandemic world

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: At the centre of the COVID-19 storm, one agency is tasked with coordinating the world's response. But what powers does it actually have?
item.title: Who’s the WHO? And how did it get caught between China and Trump?

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The state's total increased by two to 1054: the nurse, and a Queensland resident previously diagnosed in Western Australia.
item.title: Queensland COVID-positive aged care nurse worked while unwell, delayed test

item.dc:creator: Katrina Strickland
item.description: Hear Melissa Fyfe and Henrietta Cook's story that explores the increasingly menacing behaviour of parents toward school staff, followed by a discussion with Karen Terry, a Victorian secondary school principal, on how teachers are coping during COVID-19.
item.title: Are parents the new school bullies?

item.dc:creator: Orietta Guerrera
item.description: Some readers see a re-evaluation of Australia's strategic relationships as a silver lining to the pandemic. For others, the challenges ahead seemed insurmountable.
item.title: 'Fog of delusion' lifts on Australia's relationship with the US and China

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Knox
item.description: Every dollar spent in rugby league is being clawed back, even the cents spent on referees. But one stakeholder is set up to do very nicely.
item.title: Gambling's share of NRL revenue could well double. That brings power

item.dc:creator: Caroline Wilson
item.description: Adelaide appear to have got off lightly for their COVID-19 protocol breaches because of fears there could be an avalanche of player suspensions across the competition.
item.title: AFL paying a heavy price for failing to throw book at Crows

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Telstra blames clumsy construction workers for widespread internet outage in Box Hill and Mont Albert which is making working, studying from home more difficult.
item.title: Construction workers blamed for internet blackout in Melbourne's east

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Australian steel producer Bluescope has told investors it has had to resort to manual operations in some segments of the business after a cyber attack.
item.title: BlueScope Steel says cyber 'incident' causing disruptions

item.description: To expect a driver of Daniel Ricciardo's pedigree and value to ride shotgun was little more than a romantic thought for fans linking the Australian with Ferrari.
item.title: Why Daniel Ricciardo passed up the chance to join Ferrari

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Coronavirus-related bad debt charges of almost $5 billion dominated the latest bank results, but some experts say there is more pain to come.
item.title: Bunkering down: Australia's banks brace for recession

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: As the SANZAAR nations try to map out Super Rugby in the post-COVID-19 world, a bold plan to include the best Japanese teams is on the table.
item.title: Top League meets Super Rugby: bold plan to keep Japan involved

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: There was some confusion about whether Queenslanders could have more people over if everyone sat outside.
item.title: New Queensland rules this weekend, what you need to know

item.dc:creator: Benjamen Judd
item.description: Peering at what might have been shown at the Fashion Week That Wasn’t is a reminder of a life we will soon be able to return to.
item.title: Hold on to your linen: What men will be wearing next summer

item.description: The former CNN anchor who now runs her own production company has used her social media account to take her peers to task before her 1.2 million followers.
item.title: 'Boss lady' Soledad O'Brien keeps her journalist peers in line

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Businesses argue they can't afford a higher minimum wage, the industrial umpire is consulting on delaying any rise for businesses on JobKeeper.
item.title: Waiting on a pay rise? It could be longer for low paid workers

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson
